intro: Eurya rubiginosa var. rubiginosa, commonly known as the red-berried eurya, is a species of evergreen shrub native to eastern Asia. It typically grows to a height of 1–3 meters and features small, oval-shaped leaves that are glossy and dark green. The plant produces clusters of small, white flowers in the spring, which are followed by bright red berries in the fall. These berries are an important food source for birds and other wildlife. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value and ability to thrive in shaded environments.
